List of outcomes reported within the defined category.

Any measure of antioxidant and/or oxidant activity or quantity (e.g. serum catalase and/or malondialdehyde). This excludes any instance where oxidants or antioxidants are measured by gene expression (see "Gene expression").
Any measure of body colour collected from any part of the body.
Any test where the endpoint is measured as detachment of the abalone from the tank or relevant substrate (e.g. heat adhesion studies).

Any measure of enzymes responsible for the breakdown of feed components (e.g. lipase and/or trypsin activity). This excludes any instance where enzyme activity is measured by gene expression (see "Gene expression")
Any measure of enzyme activity which is not otherwise defined by another listed category.
Any observation or measurement of how the abalone interacts with feed (e.g. feed intake, palatability and/or meal acceptance).
Any measure of transcriptional activity of genes.
Any outcome which measures the growth of the abalone (e.g. weight gain, feed conversion ratio and/or shell length gain).
Any measure or description reported through observation of histopathology.
Any measure of innate immune activity (e.g. total hemocyte counts and/or phagocytic activity).
Any measurement of respiratory activity and/or waste production (e.g. oxygen intake and/or nitrogen excretion).
Any measurement of small molecules (metabolites) within abalone cells or tissues.
Any measurement of the diversity, quantity or species of bacteria within abalone tissue. This excludes instances where pathogenic species are targeted (see "Pathogen load").
Any measure which investigates assimilation, uptake or utilisation of feed nutrients (e.g. abalone muscle composition, digestibility coefficients and/or protein deposition).
Any measurement which qunatifies or identifies pathogens within abalone tissue.
Any measure of perceptible, product quality attribute (e.g. flavour compounds, texture, smell).
Survival of abalone.
Any other outcome measure which does not fit definitions of the above categories but could reasonably be considered a measure of biological performance.
Atleast one outcome measure has been collected / reported more than once for the same cohort.
All outcome measures are collected / reported for a single time point.
The study assesses performance or physiological response under normal, non-stressful conditions, which are intended to reflect “optimal” husbandry.
The experiment manipulates the environment to test the animals' tolerance and resilience under suboptimal conditions.
Any challenge conditions which expose abalone to air.
Any challenge conditions which expose abalone to pathogenic bacteria species.
Any challenge conditions which expose abalone to sub-optimum salinity levels. The article must disclose that the salinity is considered a challenge condition.
Any challenge conditions which expose abalone to sub-optimum water temperatures. The article must disclose that the water temperature is considered a challenge condition.
Any other condition which does not fit definitions of the above categories but could reasonably be considered a challenge condition.
